thread.title: Lincoln hero Sean Raggett is an Arsenal fan who's NEVER seen them live - now he's closing on PLAYING against them
thread.title_full: Lincoln hero Sean Raggett is an Arsenal fan who's NEVER seen them live - now he's closing on PLAYING against them - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Lincoln hero Sean Raggett is an Arsenal fan who's NEVER seen them live - now he's closing on PLAYING against them
text:
Lincoln hero Sean Raggett is an Arsenal fan who's NEVER seen them live - now he's closing on PLAYING against them The giant defender scored the only goal at Turf Moor as the non-leaguers saw off Premier League Burnley Share Comments By David Maddock 22:30, 19 FEB 2017 Sport Sean Raggett after knocking out Burnley (Photo: REUTERS) Arsenal FC Lincoln hero Sean Raggett could finally get the chance to see his beloved Arsenal live - from the best seat in the house.
The history-making FA Cup giant killers were pitted against the Gunners in the quarter-final draw, as the competition maintained its dramatic impact this season, with a last eight that also includes a Jose Mourinho return to Chelsea with Manchester United.
But it is Lincoln who grabbed the headlines as they were given a plum tie at the Emirates, should Arsenal overcome fellow National League side Sutton this evening.
And Raggett, who produced the moment of this season’s competition so far with a last-minute winner at Burnley, revealed afterwards that he is a Gunners fan who has never actually had the chance to watch his team in the flesh.
Now, he will see his hero Alexis Sanchez close up - by marking him.
Lincoln City's Sean Raggett heads the ball to score (Photo: AFP) Raggett could be set to go up against Alexis (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Read More Lincoln City fans go wild as the Imps prepare for dream quarter-final clash “I said I wanted Arsenal because I’ve always been a fan. It would be so special,” he admitted.
“I’ve never been to watch Arsenal, because I was with Gillingham as a kid and then since I was 16 I’ve been playing football every Saturday...so to play against them would be unbelievable, wouldn’t it!
“Imagine. The first time I see them live in person is when I’m playing against them. It would be incredible.”
Raggett celebrates his winner - and now gets a taste of Arsenal (Photo: Clive Brunskill) The Gunners still have to get past Sutton of course, and Lincoln keeper Paul Farman believes his side have shown an upset is possible, by becoming the first non-league team in the quarter final in 103 years.
“Sutton are a good team. They are a big side which might trouble Arsenal. If they have worked like us this week then they stand a chance,” he said.
But if the Gunners do get through, then Lincoln will go to the Emirates in front of a massive TV audience with the chance to make history by reaching Wembley - and their manager Danny Cowley insists it is eminently possible for his side now.
Cowley is facing a trip to the Emirates - or Gander Green Lane (Photo: Clive Brunskill) “You never know in football do you? Who would have thought as a non league team starting out in the fourth qualifying round we would have got this far,” he said.
“We have a unique style for Premier League teams and that’s what we worked on against Burnley. The way we play is very different so we present different problems.
“Against one of the big ones we will try to put a game-plan together that uses our strengths - they will not be used to playing a side like us.”
While Lincoln’s physical approach will most certainly upset the Gunners, the draw still offered the enticing prospect of north London v Manchester semi final draw, with United, City, Spurs and Arsenal kept apart in the last eight.
